intro: Epilobium adnatoparviflorum, commonly known as narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in width. Its small, pink to purple flowers are arranged in dense spikes and bloom in the summer months. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species such as the common willowherb and evening primrose.
